results.title: A City's child
results.creator_credit: Brian Kavanagh, Experimental Film and Television Fund of the Australian Council for the Arts and Kavanagh Productions
results.brief_description: An award-winning dramatic treatment of individual loneliness in a large city. Monica Maughan plays a spinster approaching middle age who lives with a dominating mother. After the death of her mother, unable to make human contact, she slips into a fantasy world in which a small doll becomes her “daughter”. The film was shot on 16mm for about $30,000.

results.title: A Citizen of Singapore
results.creator_credit: Brian Salt, Gaumont-British Instructional and Malayan Film Unit
results.brief_description: Through the story of a seven-year-old, Hung Swee Kiat, the film outlines the scope and progress of Singapore’s Ten Year Development Scheme to provide free education for all children, regardless of race and creed. The film closes with official ceremonies at a youth rally which concluded Education Week, during which exhibitions and displays brought the Scheme to the notice of the public.

results.title: A Circus story
results.creator_credit: Marshall Riggan, Major Carpenter, Barr Films and Marshall Majors Productions
results.brief_description: An account of the arrival, setting up and the performance of a circus in the small town of Berrybille, Arkansas, USA. Discusses the status, role and function of the circus today and suggests reasons for the romantic appeal of the circus. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: A Christmas dream [English version]
results.creator_credit: Karel Zeman and United World Films
results.brief_description: A fantasy in which a little girl’s toys come to life in a dream - the toys being played by Puppets. (The film is noteworthy for the excellence of the puppet animation in the original material - for American distribution, introductory and concluding sequences have been added to the film by Castle Films, USA.). This film was directed by Karel Zeman at the Gottwaldov Puppet Studios, Czechoslovakia.

results.title: A Children's welcome
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: This film was made in honour of the Queen Mother’s visit to Melbourne on March 3rd, 1958. A performance for the Queen Mother, by the school children of Victoria, was staged at the Melbourne Cricket Ground with items arranged by the Physical Education Department and accompanied by the RAAF Band. Family and friends were gathered in the stands of the MCG to watch and cheer on the children. At the end of the performance, the Queen Mother toured in an open car around the MCG.

results.title: A Child is a child (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Molly Gorelick, A L Levitt, AIMS Instructional Media and Dubnoff Center
results.brief_description: Shows children with handicaps integrated with non-handicapped children in the pre-school laboratory at California State University, Northridge. It shows that the trend towards special education for children with handicaps has gone so far that many educators tend to lose sight of the fundamental fact that a child is a child.

results.title: A Child's visit to the dentist
results.brief_description: Designed to allay children’s fear of the dentist and all that dentists represent, by following a five-fear-old on her first visit to the dentist. Outlines the function of various people working in the surgery, as well as explaining the purposes of X-ray machines, drills, scrapers, etc.

results.title: A Chemical feast
results.creator_credit: Jack Sameth, Penny Bernstein and Benchmark Films
results.brief_description: Presents a humorous look at the chemical composition of a lemon meringue pie and the unit value of four convenience foods. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: A Charles Dickens christmas
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Dramatizes incidents from Charles Dickens’ novel “The Pickwick Papers”, recounting the cross-country winter coach trip of Mr. Pickwick and his friends and their attendance at christmas festivities at Dingley Dell Farm. Includes reproductions of some of Robert Seymour’s original illustrations.

results.title: A Changing view of the change of life
results.creator_credit: Hy Kalus, Walter Lowendahl and Dynamic Productions
results.brief_description: Many questions relating to menopause are answered in this candid and informative film for women of all ages, and their families. Modern medical research has made startling discoveries about this period in a woman’s life and these have altered the traditional concepts about menopause. The film presents new attitudes and shows how doctors are dealing with the physical and emotional problems.
